p: With regard to the genus level, Streptococcus was a core component of the microbiome, accounting for 21.8% of bacteria, with Fusobacterium and Prevotella also abundant (comprising 15.4% and 9.9%, respectively). Neisseria, Haemophilus, and Campylobacter each accounted for 2â€“5% of the microbiota ( Figure 7). Differences were identified between the ILI/S flu+ and AC groups ( Figure 7), with a significant increase in the relative abundance of Prevotella on days 3 and 28 in the challenged group ( P < .05) and an increase in Fusobacterium by day 28 in the challenged group ( P < .05). Within the ILI/S flu+ group, a minor increase in Actinomyces was observed at day 6 post-infection ( P < .05) and, in parallel, Haemophilus decreased ( P < .01; Figure 8).
